sub_topic: Identifying the clique number of a graph.
message_1:
What is the clique number of a graph G shown below? 

(Image of a graph with vertices and edges) 

Hint: A clique is a subset of vertices in a graph where every vertex in the subset is connected to all the other vertices in the subset. The clique number of a graph is the size of the largest clique in the graph.
message_2: Unfortunately, I cannot see or interpret images. Please provide a textual description of the graph, including the number of vertices and the connections between them, and I will be happy to help you find the clique number.
